snippet: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe is caught between trying to improve relations with the United States and opposition on Okinawa to an American military presence.
abstract: Japanese Prime Min Shinzo Abe says he will not ask Okinawan authorities for approval to begin constructing long-stalled American air base; statement casts doubt on his government's hopes to show progress in troubled base relocation plan ahead of his trip to United States.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe is caught between trying to improve relations with the United States and opposition on Okinawa to an American military presence.

headline.seo: Japanese Premier Holds Back on U.S. Base Relocation
headline.main: Japanese Premier Won’t Take Step in Relocating U.S. Base Before Meeting Obama

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
